intro: Ficus hirsuta var. fuliginea, commonly known as the sooty ficus, is a variant of the common ficus species characterized by its dark, almost blackish foliage. This plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is known for its dense, compact growth habit. The leaves are typically glossy and have a leathery texture, which helps it thrive in humid environments. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ability to tolerate low light conditions. The varietal name "fuliginea" refers to the sooty or dark coloration of its leaves, distinguishing it from other ficus varieties.
